meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by monism.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher presented a monistic view of the universe.
meanings.sent2: Her monistic beliefs influenced her approach to life.
meanings.sent3: The monistic cat insisted that all treats should be shared equally among the feline community.
meanings.sent4: The artist's monistic painting blended all colors into a harmonious whole.
meanings.sent5: The monistic theory proposed that everything in existence is interconnected.

meanings.definition: Believing in the doctrine of monism.
meanings.sent1: As a monistic thinker, he saw the world as a unified whole.
meanings.sent2: She held a monistic perspective that all things are fundamentally one.
meanings.sent3: The monistic student joked that even pizza toppings should be in perfect unity.
meanings.sent4: His monistic approach to problem-solving focused on finding underlying connections.
meanings.sent5: The monistic belief in oneness guided her spiritual journey.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a monist.
meanings.sent1: The monistic scholar's work explored the implications of unity in all things.
meanings.sent2: She attended a monistic gathering to discuss philosophical ideas.
meanings.sent3: The monistic group organized a potluck where all dishes had to complement each other perfectly.
meanings.sent4: In the monistic community, diversity was celebrated as a reflection of underlying unity.
meanings.sent5: His monistic perspective shaped his interactions with the world around him.
